channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 31
item.description:
August 31, 2020 7:49 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Monday, Aug 31.

item.title: Covid-19 swab booths on trial at 170 clinics
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Swab booths are now located at 170 clinics islandwide to allow testing for those showing signs of Covid-19 infection, while guarding the safety of general practitioners, clinic staff and other patients.

item.title: Five of eight new community cases part of a family cluster
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Five of the eight new community cases of Covid-19 infection reported yesterday were part of a family cluster involving two households, said the Ministry of Health (MOH).

item.title: Little India reels from pandemic impact with no tourists, foreign workers
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

One by one, nine establishments around Mr K. Ramamoorthy's Internet cafe in Upper Dickson Road have shuttered, and he fears his might be next.

item.title: Coronavirus: DSO targets on-site testing to keep SAF camps safe from outbreaks of infectious diseases including Covid-19
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 50 scientists have been working on these Covid-19 efforts.

item.title: New SCDF vehicle taps technology to treat first responders' heat injuries
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Emergency responders in prolonged operations now have a rehabilitation area and can receive treatment for a range of heat injuries in a Responders' Performance Vehicle (RPV).

item.title: Smooth boarding for China flight after initial scramble for tests
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Passengers headed to Guangzhou early yesterday morning appeared to have no issues boarding Scoot Flight TR100 despite having had to scramble to undergo last-minute Covid-19 tests after the Chinese Embassy announced new requirements.

item.title: New booths boost safety for swab tests
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Booths have been installed at 170 clinics to bolster safety for doctors, clinic staff and their patients during swab tests.

item.title: Experts see scope for taking away road space from cars to make way for buses, cyclists or pedestrians downtown
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Doing so would revitalise street-level retail and make public transport smoother and more attractive, experts said.

item.title: Mustafa Centre cuts staff amid retail woes
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Employees of Mustafa Centre who have not been called back to work have been asked to find a second job to earn an income, after the company announced it will stop paying them allowance from October.

item.title: What others have done about road space during Covid-19
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Several US cities, including Portland and Oakland, had closed off roads temporarily during the Covid-19 pandemic to help facilitate social distancing among pedestrians, with some even introducing permanent changes.

item.title: Apex court rulings in 3 drug trafficking appeals clarify key issues
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Three recent drug trafficking appeal cases, which all led to acquittals before the apex court, have clarified key issues in these laws.

item.title: First female operator for elite police unit
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

A car screeched to a halt right in the middle of a "terrorist attack", and four heavily armoured police officers hopped out of the vehicle and directly into the line of fire.

item.title: Joint effort, tech in prosecuting white-collar crimes: AGC
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

While technology misuse can lead to the theft of millions with a few keystrokes, updated technology has also helped prosecutors find the proverbial needle in the haystack, or digital evidence.

item.title: GBS spike: No raw fish sold at stalls patients visited
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Raw fish dishes were not sold by food stalls visited by patients who recently contracted bacterial infections.

item.title: Mustafa to send home some foreign staff after business is hit
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Mustafa Centre will send home its foreign workers whose work passes have expired as its business has been hard hit by the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: The show must go on(line)
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Like a bizarre dream, the snazzily lit stage comes alive with the usual song-and-dance routine, but there is no audience below it.

item.title: Two hurt after ventilation duct falls from cinema ceiling at Nex mall
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

A ventilation duct collapsed from the ceiling of a cinema hall at Nex shopping mall yesterday during a movie, injuring two people.

item.title: Keeping remand numbers in check with e-tagging and reduced bail
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Reviewing remand numbers, tracking remand cases and considering moves to offer bail to more, instead of keeping accused persons in remand.

item.title: S'pore team studying why some hit by Covid-19 suffer heart damage
item.description:
August 31, 2020 5:00 AM

A team of doctors and researchers in Singapore has started a cardiac research programme to better understand why some patients who are hit hard by Covid-19 also suffer heart damage, and how to prevent this from happening.

item.title: Hand hygiene continues to be the best deterrent against Covid-19
Four health concerns every woman should pay attention to
Coronavirus: 5 of 8 community cases part of cluster involved in family gatherings
item.description:
August 31, 2020 12:02 AM

The Ministry of Health said that the authorities were investigating whether any safe distancing rules were breached.
